data.title: Gnome Software Center integration no longer works.
data.body:
See discussion in #13904 and http://logs.openra.net/index.php?year=2017&month=08&day=26#10:53:43.

The simplest and most compatible fix will be to split openra.appdata.xml into a template file that we duplicate and modify for each of the three mods.

data.title: Split Actor.Bounds into RenderBounds and SelectableBounds
data.body:
Additionally, internally renamed `VisualBounds` to `SelectionOverlayBounds` to avoid confusion with `RenderBounds`.

This step was necessary to prevent actors with selectable area smaller than their graphics to be removed too early from ScreenMap even though part of the graphics should still be visible.
RA cruisers were a prime example, but to a lesser extent several other actors were affected as well.

This also serves as preparation to determine the final `RenderBounds` from multiple source bounds without worrying about the selectable area, to fix the remaining ScreenMap issues (building 'bibs', aircraft shadows, parachuted infantry shadows and possibly a few more edge cases).

data.title: Simple OpenRA map coding
data.body:
I am trying to auto-generate simple OpenRA maps with only 2 types of tiles - water and land. I do not wish to use the in-game Map Editor, because it will take 1000x longer to accomplish things. I have an array of 1's and 0's corresponding to land and water tiles. 

How do I generate a map.bin file with this? 

Feel free to direct me to any of the OpenRA Utility code that might point me in the right direction. I have experience reading/writing binary files, but the map.bin files are non-trivial to figure out. If someone can explain the format, that would help.

data.title: Use curl instead of wget in fetch-thirdparty-deps.
data.body: Closes #13888.

data.title: [bleed] RevealOnDeath trait leaves a small time gap with no vision.
data.body: In between the unit's default vision and its RevealOnDeath trait vision there's a flicker of time where neither is active. True for all RA units with the trait added.

But why this doesn't work while Cruiser does? https://gist.github.com/MustaphaTR/95cd5e1b5f5b859184f9ed8a2c6b8734

[exception-2017-08-23T145140Z.txt](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/1245965/exception-2017-08-23T145140Z.txt)

data.title: Adjust IsAtGroundLevel fixing EjectOnDeath
data.body:
Fixes `EjectOnDeath` ejecting pilots even when at ground level. The aircraft actor is already dead the time `EjectOnDeath` runs and thus `self.IsAtGroundLevel` was always `false`.

I didn't notice any side-effects from removing the (unnecessary) `IsDead` check from `IsAtGroundLevel`.

data.title: Don't spawn aircraft husks when not airborne
data.body: As suggested by @GraionDilach in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/13889#issuecomment-324155789.

data.title: d2k: sonic weapon fix.
data.body: #13870 was PR'd against `next`.

data.title: Allow more nuanced uses with RevealOnDeath
data.body:
It's not the most clear cut language on this issue ticket but following the discussion from: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13878#issuecomment-323622192

RevealOnDeath cannot currently be used selectively with grounded aircraft and crashing aircraft. Also cannot differentiate between a killed and a detonated MAD Tank where the latter would reveal a significant vision radius to reveal the damage dealt.

Pretty peculiar request but if there's a solution forthcoming, could be a nice immediate polish and perhaps expand the trait for other uses as well.

data.title: OpenRA build on Linux uses both curl and wget
data.body:
While building from a freshly installed Linux build system, I noticed that the build scripts require both of these tools, instead of only one of them.

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAModSDK/issues/36 (see the discussion here)

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/57fb5515456dd688f29ed91e67aa09a21d644dec/thirdparty/fetch-thirdparty-deps-windows.sh#L22
